section.text: C arrays allow you to make a list of values of one type into one variable without declaring multiple variables.
You can only change values in the array you can't add or remove any values after declaring the array.
Declaring arrays in C is very similar to normal variables, there are only a few differences.

section.text: Modifying an array is very simple, you just can only modify predefined data not add or remove any as told above.
To modify the data its similar to normal variables but now you have to give it the index of the value you want to modify.

program.name: main.c
program: printf("Jimmy's old address is %d Conway St.\n", studentAddresses[2]);
printf("Jimmy's new address is %d Sean Dr.\n", studentAddresses[2]);

Jimmy's old address is 12 Conway St.
Jimmy's new address is 30 Sean Dr.
